page.title: 08Hoppers Hospital F.Oak Green
page.content: The original four house terrace was built in the 18th century. It became a pub,'The Rose and Crown', where hoppickers would drink on September evenngs. Father Richard Wilson,an East End priest from Stepney,heard of the squalor,drunkeness and deprivation of the hoppers.He accompanied them one Septmber,ran a temperance campaign and improved their living conditions. In 1906 he bought 'The Rose and Crown' converting several rooms to provide a children's ward a games room and a sheltered courtyard furnished with 2 fireplaces.Here hoppers would enjoy lantern shows nourishing food and singing and dancing to a barrel organ. 'The Little Hoppers Hospital',now owned by The Red House Trust,has been improved to provide a holiday home for London priests and parishioners.
